mssql.logDebugInfo.description: [Optional] Log debug output to the VS Code console (Help -> Toggle Developer Tools)

mssql.maxRecentConnections.description: The maximum number of recently used connections to store in the connection list.

mssql.connections.description: Connection profiles defined in 'User Settings' are shown under 'MS SQL: Connect' command in the command palette.

server.description: [Required] Specify the server name to connect to. Use 'hostname\instance' or '<server>.database.windows.net' for Azure SQL Database.

database.description: [Optional] Specify the database name to connect to. If database is not specified, the default user database setting is used, typically 'master'.

user.description: [Optional] Specify the user name for SQL Server authentication. If user name is not specified, when you connect, you will be asked again.

password.description: [Optional] Specify the password for SQL Server authentication. If password is not specified or already saved, when you connect, you will be asked again.

authenticationType.description: [Optional] Specify the SQL Server authentication type.

port.description: [Optional] Specify the port number to connect to.

encrypt.description: [Optional] When set to 'true', SQL Server uses SSL encryption for data sent between the client and the server if the server has a certificate installed. Set 'true' for Azure SQL Database connection.

trustServerCertificate.description: [Optional] When set to 'true', the SQL Server SSL certificate is automatically trusted when the communication layer is encrypted using SSL. Set 'false' for Azure SQL Database connection.

persistSecurityInfo.description: [Optional] When set to false, security-sensitive information, such as the password, is not returned as part of the connection if the connection is open or has ever been in an open state.

connectTimeout.description: [Optional] Specify the length of time in seconds to wait for a connection to the server before it times out. The default timeout value for Azure SQL Database is 30.

connectRetryCount.description: [Optional] Specify the number of attempts to restore connection.

connectRetryInterval.description: [Optional] Specify the delay between attempts to restore connection.

applicationName.description: [Optional] Specify the name of the application used for SQL Server to log (default: 'vscode-mssql').

workstationId.description: [Optional] Specify the name of the workstation connecting to SQL Server.

applicationIntent.description: [Optional] Declares the application workload type when connecting to SQL Server such as ReadWrite or ReadOnly. Refer to SQL Server AlwaysOn for more detail.

currentLanguage.description: [Optional] Indicates the SQL Server language settings.

pooling.description: [Optional] When set to 'true', the connection object is drawn from the appropriate pool, or if necessary, is created and added to the appropriate pool.

maxPoolSize.description: [Optional] Specify the maximum number of connections allowed in the pool.

minPoolSize.description: [Optional] Specify the minimum number of connections allowed in the pool.

loadBalanceTimeout.description: [Optional] Specify the minimum amount of time in seconds for this connection to live in the pool before being removed/deleted.

replication.description: [Optional] Used by SQL Server in replication.

attachDbFilename.description: [Optional] Specify the name of the primary file, including the full path name, of an attachable database.

failoverPartner.description: [Optional] Specify the name or network address of the instance of SQL Server that acts as a failover partner.

multiSubnetFailover.description: [Optional] When set to 'true', the detection and connection to the active server is faster if AlwaysOn Availability Group is configured on different subnets.

multipleActiveResultSets.description: [Optional] When set to 'true', multiple result sets can be returned and read from on connection.

packetSize.description: [Optional] Specify the size in bytes of the network packets to communicate with SQL Server.

typeSystemVersion.description: [Optional] Indicates which server type the provider will expose through the DataReader.

profileName.description: [Optional] Specify a custom name for this connection profile to easily browse and search in the command palette of Visual Studio Code.

savePassword.description: [Optional] When set to 'true', the password for SQL Server authentication is saved in the secure store of your operating system such as KeyChain in MacOS or Secure Store in Windows.
